text: Characterization of the human myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen gene promoter .

<extra_id_0> MNDA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> myeloid cell nuclear differentiation antigen <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is an interferon alpha regulated nuclear protein expressed only in cells of the human myelomonocytic lineage .

text: Two interferon - stimulated response elements ( ISRE ) flank a multiple transcription start site region identifying <extra_id_0> MNDA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> as a TATA - less interferon - regulated gene .

Other DNA elements present include a cluster of Myb sites , several Ets , an Ets related <extra_id_0> PU.1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site and an <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site located within 600 bp of the transcription start sites .

text: The 5 ' flanking sequence has promoter activity which is elevated by interferon alpha .
